body.name: HPRT Photo Printer 4x6,Wi-Fi Wireless Instant Picture Printer for iPhone, Android, Smartphone, Thermal Dye-Sublimation Printer,AR Video Printing,Portable Photo Printers for Home Use
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 22 hrs 37 mins
features: Lifelike Color Printing:The HPRT CP4100 full-color photo printer4"x6" uses advanced thermal dye sublimation technology with a display resolution of 300 DPI and a color gradation of 256 colors to bring your photo prints to life in brilliant color. These crisp photos will bring your memories to life!

High Quality Photos：The HPRT thermal dye sublimation photo printer coats your precious photos with a protective film that will keep them intact for a long time, preventing water damage, scratches and fading. Keep the gorgeous memories with you for a long time.

Reduce Photo Costs:The HPRT instant picture printer comes with a ribbon and 20 sheets (4 "x6") of photo paper, so you can print as soon as you get the printer! In addition, thermal transfer paper is more cost-effective than other printing methods, and you can save even more if you purchase our thermal transfer paper in a bundle with this printer!

Instant Convenience:The HPRT phone picture printer features Wi-Fi connectivity and is portable photo printer for iphone,Android, and smartphone,just download the Heyphoto app. You can connect the printer directly to your phone or to the same Wi-Fi connection for printing. Whether it's a party, Christmas or Halloween, you can instantly capture your loved ones and friends having fun.

AR Funny:Download Heyphoto APP to print wirelessly, the APP has a variety of sizes printing function such as 6", 5", 3", 2", 1", etc., a variety of filters and borders to choose from, the AR printing function supports printing video, cropping video, after printing, click on the AR scanning to align the photos to be played back, giving you a wonderful printing experience!

Can HPRT4*6 photo paper and ribbonsbe adapted to other machines? No, HPRT papers and ribbons are exclusively for HPRT photo printers. How much photo paper came with this photo printer? The HPRT CP4100 Photo Printer comes with twenty sheets of photo paper and a ribbon. Where do I buy the paper and ribbon for this photo printer? You can find our 4*6 photo paper and ribbon from HPRT official flagship store. What app do I download to be able to connect the CP4100 to print photos? Download the HEY Photo app to connect to the CP4100 to print photos. What if I still can't connect to the printer inside HEY Photo? Please check that your printer is turned on and that the network is connected.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It does come with 20 pages of paper and not 10.
reviews.reviewText: It's hard to believe that mostly no one seemed to notice that it wasn't all that clear how many pages of paper actually came with this picture printer... In one place it says that it comes with 10 pages of paper, and in another it says that it comes with 20 pages of paper... 🤦 (person facepalming) And so, just to be clear again, this picture printer comes with 20 printable pages.However, I DON'T know how many pages the cartridge will last for yet. You see, when it's necessary to get another cartridge and more printable paper, it costs $25.99 (at the time of this review) to get 1 cartridge and 54 pages paper. So then, that makes me wonder. After I've used the 20 pages that initially came with this printer, will the cartridge be able to handle 34 more pages when I get them?? Or has it been made to just handle 20 pages? Well, I'd be willing to bet that it can only handle these 20 pages, lol. But hey, I could be wrong.Anyway, besides all of that, this printer seems to work very well. Even better than I expected. The only thing I don't necessarily like, is that the piece that plugs into the wall is really big an bulky. That's not that big of a deal though, as we should all be used to that type of thing by now.Now, if you are someone who is trying to decide between THIS picture printer and the one made by HP, I would actually suggest this one. I think the one by HP is like a dollar or two less than this one right now, but they don't even say ANYWHERE, whether theirs comes with a cartridge OR any printable pages! And what's more, most of the reviewers are totally oblivious to this lack of information and provide no help whatsoever... Well, luckily for whoever is reading this, after looking for a long time I finally found out that theirs DOES of course come with a cartridge and some pages of paper, but only TEN pages. AND, many people who had decided to get the HP picture printer, now find themselves with only one option when they need another cartridge and more paper. Which is, 108 pages of printable paper and 2 cartridges for $46.99. At least with this printer you can choose 1 cartridge and 54 pages for $25.99. Or you could just double it if you wanted more than that at once, and get 2 cartridges and 108 pages for $51.98. So yeah, I suppose refilling this printer costs just a little bit more, but not a whole lot. And I would still recommend this one over HP's picture printer.(Also, don't forget to keep in mind that the prices I have listed throughout my review may be different now, depending on when you are reading this. But that is what they were at the time of this review.)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars nice photo printer
reviews.reviewText: pro: high quality image reproduction; good printing speedcon: no native support - need to download app to print; ~$25 for new ink cartridge + 54 sheets of photo paper; not dust- or hair-proof (will get on freshly inked sheets)tip: each color is laid down separately, so keep both sides of the printer clear to allow paper to pass through each time for each color

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gift of Timeless Memories
reviews.reviewText: In a cozy corner of our home, where the gentle ticking of the antique clock met the soft hum of familiar tunes, I embarked on a journey to gift my mother a piece of technological enchantment—the HPRT Photo Printer. Little did I know that this seemingly unassuming device would become a conduit for weaving the fabric of her cherished memories.As the HPRT Photo Printer arrived in its neatly packaged box, adorned with the promise of instant prints and augmented reality wonders, my excitement mirrored that of a child unwrapping a long-awaited present. The sleek design and user-friendly features hinted at a world where technology embraced simplicity, and moments were preserved effortlessly.My mother, a woman of grace and wisdom, had always been hesitant when it came to navigating the realms of technology. The digital era seemed like a labyrinth of confusion, but the HPRT Photo Printer presented itself as a gentle guide. Its user-friendly interface and straightforward setup were a revelation, turning a once-intimidating device into a source of empowerment.As we embarked on our first printing adventure, selecting photos from her smartphone, there was an undeniable sense of magic in the air. The quiet whirr of the printer and the joy that radiated from my mother's eyes as the first print emerged transformed intangible digital memories into something she could touch, hold, and share.The feature that truly captured my mother's heart was the AR video printing. As we scanned the printed photos with her smartphone, she marveled at how the images came alive with embedded videos. It was a dance of nostalgia and modernity—a perfect fusion that resonated with her love for both tradition and innovation.One of the remarkable aspects of the HPRT Photo Printer was its ability to connect generations across distances. Photos sent by family members living far away became tangible prints, effortlessly bridging the miles and transforming our home into a gallery of shared moments.The prints accumulated, forming a mosaic of our family's history. Albums were created, tabletops adorned, and each photo became a chapter in the story of our lives. The HPRT Photo Printer was more than a device; it was a storyteller, creating a legacy of togetherness that my mother could hold in her hands.As the days unfolded, the HPRT Photo Printer became an integral part of our daily lives. It wasn't just a gift; it was an embodiment of joy and ease. My mother, once hesitant about technology, embraced the printer with open arms, turning it into a tool for crafting her own narrative, one print at a time.In the quiet moments when the printer worked its magic and the room was filled with the scent of freshly printed photos, my mother found a timeless connection to the past and a bridge to the future. The HPRT Photo Printer wasn't just a technological device; it was a vessel for preserving the essence of family, love, and shared memories.So, here's to the HPRT Photo Printer—a gift that transcended generations, seamlessly merging the old and the new, and bringing the joy of technology to a woman whose heart cherished the simplicity of everlasting moments.
